interlinear-text.item: Told in Wakhi in 1967 by Mirzobek Pekhmetbekov, 40 year old Kolkhazian from the village of Zmoudg.

phrase.item: Once upon a time, there was a king:
the king had an only son.
One day, the king left his castle, went to the bazaar, and examined the bazaars a lot but bought nothing.
When he returned home,
his son asked him: "Where were you? What did you buy?"
Everything we need, we have in the palace, the father replied.
But the son said to him: Your palace and your riches are not enough for me!
Give me your approval and I will go chase King Machrik from his castle.
I do not want you to go there, said the father.
Anything you need, I will procure for you.
But the son did not obey: without his father’s permission, he set off.
He traversed many steppes and deserts, and halfway there, he met an old man.
"Tshandini"?
The old man greeted him, but the youth replied very disrespectfully.
So the old man said: I was once a youth like you are. Slow down, let us walk together.
Why would I take such an old, moribund man with me? Said the youth.
Then, he thought for a bit and said: Alright, let us walk together for a bit, that is well.
The old man had a leather bag on his back.
He said: "Carry my bag for a little bit, I will isolate myself for a few moments."
But the youth, despite his efforts, could not lift the bag
The old man came back and asked: "Youth, are you still waiting for me?"
"Hey, old man", the youth replied, "it’s that I can’t lift your bag."
"Well don’t joke like that," said the old man.
"No, I’m telling the truth," said the youth. So the old man asked "Well if you can’t do that, where are you headed?"
I am going to chase out the king of Machrik, answered the youth.
The old man said: You don’t have with you any escort to help you, nor servants, nor rifles, nor powder.
The youth answered: "On the other hand, I am very intelligent, and I will chase him with my words."
The old man said: "Well if that’s the case, go on."
They arrived at a site where there stood a kind of house.
The old man said: "Let us go into my house, and drink some tea."
They went into the house, the old man said to the youth: Welcome!
He welcomed him thus and brought him tea
They drank the tea,
and the old man said: I’ll give you three pieces of advice:
as long as you are not asked about something, don’t speak;
as long as nothing is asked of you, don’t give anything;
as long as nobody calls you, don’t move.
Then they left the house and continued on their way. They walked very slowly, and arrived at the palace of the king of Machrik.
clitic =ev interrupting light verb construction! what is dej??
The old man asked the youth: "Youth, if you chase the king from his throne, will you give me just a little of his riches?"
"I will," said the youth.
They entered in the royal palace.
They stopped at the gates, greeted the king, saluted.
=ev interrupts a light verb construction here
The king returned their greetings and told them to sit.
They sat next to the pillars close to the entrance.
They stayed seated for a moment, then food was placed in front of the king.
The king called them: Come eat on the nares.
They approached and sat near the food.
The king said to his household: "Give us a knife, I will cut the meat into little pieces."
So the youth took his dagger and placed it in front of the king.
The king saw that the handle of the dagger was made of rubies, sapphires, emeralds, gold, and silver, and that the blade was a diamond.
The king cut the meat and thought, if I ask for this dagger, its owner will not cede it.
If I want to buy it, he will demand an outrageous price.
He thought, thought, and asked his friends who were seated behind the food: O friends, what is the punishment for a thief?
The people stood and answered: "Either take his possessions, or kill him!"
So the king said: "The day my treasure was stolen, this dagger was on top.
‎‎Now I have found my possession,
this man is the thief!"
The king cried to the executioners: "Seize him and kill him!"
At this moment, the old man stood and said: "O king, this youth is a guest of my home tonight.
Tomorrow I’ll bring him, kill him then."
The king did not consent at first:
“He’ll run away!”
But the old man replied: "People would think badly of me if I am not able to protect my guest, if I let him be killed."
So the king agreed, and ordered him to bring the youth back the next day.
The old man left with the youth.
They arrived at a place where there was a home.
They went inside, and the old man prepared food.
He put the food down in front of the youth and said: Here, eat a bit.
"I cannot swallow anything," replied the youth
"I’ll be killed tomorrow."
He ate nothing and went to sleep.
At dawn, they rose,
the old man brought tea and said: "Youth, come drink some tea!"
He refused: “I’m going to be tortured now, nothing can get down my throat.”
The old man sat near the hearth
‎‎A cat came towards him.
The old man spoke in his ear: "Hey, crazy cat, how many times have I told you, as long as nobody asks you questions about something, don’t speak,
as long as nothing is asked of you, give nothing,
as long as you are not called, don’t move.
Now you will die.”
The youth thought, “What if he is speaking to me and not the cat.”
Then they rose and went on their way,
The youth walked slowly,
then actually kneeled down.
The old man said: Come youth, why have you slowed down?
"I’m coming right away," said the youth.
"O misfortune, thought the old man, now they will kill this youth."
Then, he told him: "Very well, here are the last recommendations I will make.
If you want to obey me, obey me; if not, do what seems best to you."
"I will do everything you order,: said the youth.
So the old man showed him what to do.
Finally, they arrived at the king’s and greeted him.
So the youth said to the king: "O king, you are a regent with no equal, like a threshing floor with no wind.
First interrogate, then execute."
What is the meaning of this? Asked the king.
The youth said: "Good people, I am neither a thief nor a spy.
My father was also king.
One day my father left his palace and went to the bazaar.
There, he was killed; this dagger was planted right in his heart.
As a child, I admired this dagger.
When I grew up, I started to think: who killed my father?
I started wandering from town to town looking for my father’s assassin, and I was never able to find the dagger’s owner.
Since you are the owner of this dagger, bring me my father['s blood money]!
"What is this speech?" the king wondered.
But the high dignitaries decided: "The law is on the side of the youth.
He is from a strange land,
but he is neither an enemy nor a spy. Since you recognize that you are the owner of the dagger, this means you killed his father.
That is why you must pay him his father’s blood.
So the king asked: "How much does his father’s blood cost?"
The high dignitaries decided: "20 horses packed with gold."
The king gave the youth twenty horses of gold.
The youth left the palace for home;
he and the old man arrived at a steppe, and there the old man said to him: "Well now I will leave you."
The youth offered that he take the gold for himself. "You saved my life," he said.
But the old man answered: "This gold is yours, go live to my health,
and beware, next time keep your tongue behind your teeth."
And that is all, if this happened or not, we do not know.
